title: I used EZ Bankruptcy filing for my Chapter 7 case to be filed soon. My friend reviewed it and said I need to use 2011 forms.
question: Do I have to do this all over again on updated forms. I noticed that some of the forms on this package was dated 2007.
answers:
Updated forms is only the tip of the iceberg. What is important is the information that they contain. You may not list your assets properly and the trustee may not be amused or you may skip liabilities and you may not be relieve form those liabilities. The same goes with your income and expenses, as your case may be converted to Chapter 13 if there is too much money left or your car loan may not be reaffirm if it is too short depending on different factors as your family size, secured loans, etc . You have to choose the exemptions that better fit your needs.

Having said that and you still want to go "solo", go to the link below (http://www.cacb.uscourts.gov/) and good luck.
You must use the most recent forms. You can get them from the court's website.

You should have an attorney assisting you. NOT a friend. It is foolish to proceed without attorney assistance. Over 97% of chapter 7 cases with an attorney representing the debtor result in a no asset determination. About 40% of non-attorney represented cases result in the loss of something by the filer because they did not know how to protect their assets.

Of course you should be using the current forms, so if you insist on going forward on your own, you should pay EZ Bankruptcy for its most recent version, so you can be using the forms the court will accept. Otherwise you risk having your case dismissed.

Some changed some did not. Download a copy of the petition from the courts website and compare them.

Jonathan Leventhal, esq.
Leventhal Law Group, P.C.
818-347-5800

You always need to use up to date forms. But there may be documents required that you're software won't have/know about. Contact a bankruptcy attorney. We provide free consultations.

If the forms you are using are from 2007, they are too old. You must use the current forms, some of which have only recently been updated. Check the bankruptcy court's website, they have all the current forms available for download.
